Abstract
We consider the parastatistics algebra with both parabosonic and parafermionic operators and show that the states in the universal parastatistics
Fock space are in bijection with the Super Semistandard Young Tableaux
(SSYT). Using deformation of the parastatistics algebra we get a monoid
structure on SSYT which is a super version of the plactic monoid.

The creation parastatistics algebra P S(V ) is universal in the following

An exhaustive study of the parabosonic Fock space F (0|n; p) of parastatistics
order p was done in [3] (see also their contribution in this volume).
The creation parastatistics algebra P S(V ) interesting in its own, it provides
a U (glm|n )-model for the polynomial U (glm|n )-modules indexed by Young diagrams, that is, in its decomposition into U (glm|n )-irreducibles all tensor representations appear once and exactly once. Having this in mind one can index the
states in the parastatistics Fock space1 by super semistandard Young tableaux
with entries {1, . . . m, 1̄, . . . , n̄} (see below).

4 Deformed para-Fock Space and Superplactic Algebra
The parastatistics algebras (3) of creation and annihilation operators allow for
q-deformations introduced by Palev [6]. The idea is to replace the universal enveloping algebra U (osp1+2m|2n ) by the quantum UEA Uq (osp1+2m|2n ) written
in an alternative form, with a system of relations between generators corresponding to the parastatistics creation and annihilation operators. We are going to
describe the deformation PS(V ) of the creation parastatistics algebra P S(V ).
The space PS(V ) is naturally a Uq (glm|n )-module and instead of working with
the Uq (osp1+2m|2n ) relations we choose another approach based on the q-Schur
modules and the Hecke algebra. Our aim is to extract from PS(V ) a combinatorial algebra having as elements the super semistandard Young tableaux.

which are Z2 -graded version of the Knuth relations, thus this superalgebra is
the superfication P lacZ2 (V ) of the algebra of the plactic monoid [8].
We fix reading rules attaching to any SSY T a representative word in P lacZ2 (V )
written with letters {1, . . . m, 1̄, . . . , n̄} of the signed alphabet V = V0 ⊕ V1 .
To each state in P S(V ) and PS(V ) corresponds a single word in P lacZ2 (V )
(modulo the super-Knuth relations). Putting the words of two SSYT one next to
the other we get the word of a new SSYT, i.e., we have a structure of monoid
(forgetting about the sign factor (−1)x̂ẑ ). The super-Knuth relations obtained in
the work [9] are the same as ours up to this factor depending on the Z2 -grading.
More details will be given in the forthcoming paper [10].
